Comments_List: We had the opportunity to practice talks, hear updates from lab members on current projects, and engage in journal club-style discussions about current methods-focused research papers.

This course was an amazing opportunity to further my knowledge of topics related to development, methods, and clinical populations through interesting presentations and engaging discussions. Through this experience I enjoyed asking questions and discussing frontier research with colleagues. This course also provided professional development opportunities through student presentations--the feedback was invaluable!
Bringing in outside speakers, having more journal-club-like meetings, and discussing methods as a group would be nice but overall, this lab meeting seems to fit our needs well.
Yes, this is a welcoming community of researchers that discusses critical open questions in the field of clinical affective neuroscience and development. What a great way to learn!
